snippet: Strong economic data overshadowed growth concerns in China and Europe, as well as fears about the impact of the federal spending cuts that took effect on Friday.
abstract: Stocks advance modestly, leaving Standard & Poor's 500-stock index with slight gains following volatile week; strong economic data overshadows growth concerns in China and Europe, as well as fears about impact of federal spending cuts.
lead_paragraph: Strong economic data overshadowed growth concerns in China and Europe, as well as fears about the impact of the federal spending cuts that took effect on Friday.

headline.seo: Stocks Gain on Friday After Volatile Week
headline.main: Volatile Week on Wall Street Ends With Modest Gains
headline.print_headline: A Volatile Week Ends With Modest Gains
